snippet: Some few months since, a gentleman of Pennsylvania, at the request of eight members of the State Senate, wrote a letter to General WINFIELD SCOTT, addressing him as the undoubted Whig candidate for the Presidency, and requesting his opinions upon ...
lead_paragraph: Some few months since, a gentleman of Pennsylvania, at the request of eight members of the State Senate, wrote a letter to General WINFIELD SCOTT, addressing him as the undoubted Whig candidate for the Presidency, and requesting his opinions upon the various political questions which have agitated the country.
abstract: Letters to Members of Penn Legislature in the Presidency
